column1: 2 ^ Confitébor tìbi
column2: Dòmine
column3: in toto corde meo~; narrábo òmnia mirabìlia tua. ^ I will give praise to thee
column5: with my whole heart~; I will relate all thy wonders.

column1: 3 ^ Laĕtábor et exsultábo in te~; psallem nómini tuo
column2: Altìssime
column3: ^ I will be glad
column4: and rejoice in thee~; I will sing to thy name

column1: 4 ^ In convertèndo inimícum meum retrórsum~; infirmabùntur et períbunt a fácie tua. ^ When my enemy shall be turned back~; they shall be weakened and perish before thy face.
5 ^ Qŭóniam fecìsti judìcium meum et caŭsam meam~; sêdìsti super tronum qŭi júdicas justìtiam. ^ For thou hast maintained my judgment and my cause~; thou hast sat on the throne
column2: who judgest justice.

column1: 6 ^ Increpavìsti gentes
column2: et perívit ìmpius~; nomen eórum delevìsti in aĕtèrnum et in sáĕculum sáĕculi. ^ Thou hast rebuked the Gentiles
column3: and the wicked one hath perished~; thou hast blotted out their name for ever and ever.

column1: 7 ^ Inimíci defecérunt frámeaĕ in finem
column2: et civitátes eórum destruxìsti. Perívit memória eórum cum sónitu~; ^ The swords of the enemy have failed unto the end
column3: and their cities thou hast destroyed. Their memory hath perished with a noise~;

column1: 8 ^ et Dòminus in aĕtèrnum pèrmanet. Parávit in judìcio tronum suum
column2: ^ but the Lord remaineth for ever. He hath prepared his throne in judgment

column1: 9 ^ et ìpse judicábit orbem terraĕ in aĕqŭitáte~; judicábit pòpulos in justìtia. ^ and he shall judge the world in equity~; he shall judge the people in justice.
10 ^ Et factus èst Dòminus refúgium páŭperi~; adjútor in opportunitátibus
column2: in tribulatióne. ^ And the Lord is become a refuge for the poor~; a helper in due time in tribulation.

column1: 11 ^ Et sperent in te qŭi novérunt nomen tuum
column2: qŭóniam non dereliquìsti qŭaĕrèntes te
column3: Dòmine. ^ And let them trust in thee who know thy name
column4: for thou hast not forsaken them that seek thee

column1: 12 ^ Psállite Dòmino qŭi hábitat in Sióne~; adnúntiem inter gentes stúdia ejus
column2: ^ Sing ye to the Lord
column3: who dwelleth in Sion~; declare his ways among the Gentiles

column1: 13 ^ qŭóniam requírens sángŭinem eórum recordátus èst~; non èst oblítus clamórem páŭperum. ^ for requiring their blood
column2: he hath remembered them~; he hath not forgotten the cry of the poor.

column1: 14 ^ Miserére mei
column2: Dòmine~; vìde humilitátem meam de inimícîs meîs
column3: ^ Have mercy on me
column4: O Lord~; see my humiliation which I suffer from my enemies

column1: 15 ^ qŭi exáltas me de portîs mortis
column2: ut adnúntiem òmnes laŭdatiónes tuas in portîs fíliaĕ Siónis~; ^ thou that liftest me up from the gates of death
column3: that I may declare all thy praises in the gates of the daughter of Sion~;

column1: 16 ^ exsultábo in salutári tuo. Infíxaĕ sùnt gentes in intèritu
column2: qŭem fecérunt~; in láqŭeo ìsto
column3: qŭem absconduérunt comprehènsus èst pes eórum. ^ I will rejoice in thy salvation. The Gentiles have stuck fast in the destruction which they prepared~; their foot hath been taken in the very snare which they hid.

column1: 17 ^ Cognoscétur Dòminus judìcia fáciens~; in opèribus mánuum suárum comprehènsus èst peccátor. ^ The Lord shall be known when he executeth judgments~; the sinner hath been caught in the works of his own hands.
18 ^ Convertántur peccatóres in infèrnum
column2: òmnes gentes qŭaĕ obliviscùntur Deum. ^ The wicked shall be turned into hell
column3: all the nations that forget God.

column1: 19 ^ Qŭóniam non in finem oblívio èrit páŭperis~; patièntia páŭperum non períbit in finem. ^ For the poor man shall not be forgotten to the end~; the patience of the poor shall not perish for ever.
20 ^ Exsùrge
column2: Dòmine~; non confortétur hòmo~; judicèntur gentes in conspèctu tuo. ^ Arise
column3: O Lord~; let not man be strengthened~; let the Gentiles be judged in thy sight.

column1: 21 ^ Constìtue
column2: Dòmine
column3: legislatórem super eos
column4: ut sciant gentes qŭóniam hòmines sùnt. ^ Appoint
column7: that the Gentiles may know themselves to be but men.

column1: 22 ^ ¿~Ut qŭid
column2: Dòmine
column3: recessìsti longe~; déspicis in opportunitátibus
column6: hast thou retired afar off~; why dost thou slight us in our wants

column1: 23 ^ Dum supèrbit ìmpius
column2: incènditur paŭper~; comprehendùntur in consìliîs quìbus cógitant. ^ Whilst the wicked man is proud
column3: the poor is set on fire~; they are caught in the counsels which they devise.

column1: 24 ^ Qŭóniam laŭdátur peccátor in desidèriîs ánimaĕ suaĕ
column2: et iníqŭus benedícitur. ^ For the sinner is praised in the desires of his soul
column3: and the unjust man is blessed.

column1: 25 ^ Exacerbávit Dòminum peccátor~; secùndum multitúdinem iraĕ suaĕ non qŭaĕret~; non èst Deus in conspèctu ejus. ^ The sinner hath provoked the Lord~; according to the multitude of his wrath he will not seek him~; God is not before his eyes.

26 ^ Inquinátaĕ sùnt viaĕ illíus in òmni tèmpore~; aŭferùntur judìcia tua a fácie ejus~; òmnium inimicórum suórum dominábitur. ^ His ways are filthy at all times~; thy judgments are removed from his sight~; he shall rule over all his enemies.
27 ^ Dixit ènim in corde suo
column2: «~Non movébor a generatióne in generatiónem
column3: sine malo.~»^ For he hath said in his heart
column4: "I shall not be moved from generation to generation

column1: 28 ^ Cujus maledictióne os plenum èst
column2: et amaritúdine
column3: et dolo~; sub lingŭa ejus labor et dolor. ^ His mouth is full of cursing
column5: and of deceit~; under his tongue are labor and sorrow.

column1: 29 ^ Sèdet in insìdiîs cum divìtibus in occùltîs
column2: ut interfìciat innocèntem. ^ He sits in ambush with the rich in private places
column3: that he may kill the innocent.

column1: 30 ^ Òculi ejus in páŭperem respìciunt~; insidiátur in abscòndito
column2: qŭasi leo in spelùnca sua. Insidiátur ut rápiat páŭperem~; rápere páŭperem dum áttrahit eum. ^ His eyes are upon the poor man~; he lieth in wait in secret like a lion in his den. He lieth in ambush that he may catch the poor man~; to catch the poor
column3: whilst he draweth him to him.

column1: 31 ^ In láqŭeo suo humiliábit eum~; inclinábit se
column2: et cadet qŭum dominátus fúerit páŭperum. ^ In his net he will bring him down~; he will bow himself down
column3: and fall when he shall have power over the poor.

column1: 32 ^ Dixit ènim in corde suo
column2: «~Oblítus èst Deus~; avèrtit fáciem suam
column3: ne vìdeat in finem.~»^ For he hath said in his heart
column5: he hath turned away his face not to see to the end."

column1: 33 ^ Exsùrge
column2: Dòmine Deus~; exaltétur manus tu~; ne obliviscáris páŭperum. ^ Arise
column3: O Lord God~; let thy hand be exalted~; forget not the poor.

column1: 34 ^ ¿~Pròpter qŭid irritávit ìmpius Deum~? Dixit ènim in corde suo
column2: «~Non requíret.~»^ Wherefore hath the wicked provoked God~? For he hath said in his heart
column3: "He will not reqŭire it."

column1: 35 ^ Vìdes
column2: qŭóniam tu labórem et dolórem consíderas
column3: ut tradas eos in manûs tuas. Tìbi derelìctus èst paŭper~; órfano tu èris adjútor. ^ Thou seest it
column4: for thou considerest labour and sorrow
column5: that thou mayst deliver them into thy hands. To thee is the poor man left~; thou wilt be a helper to the orphan.

column1: 36 ^ Còntere bráchium peccatóris et malìgni~; qŭaĕrétur peccátum illíus
column2: et non inveniétur. ^ Break thou the arm of the sinner and of the malignant~; his sin shall be sought
column3: and shall not be found.

column1: 37 ^ Dòminus regnábit in aĕtèrnum
column2: et in sáĕculum sáĕculi~; períbitis gentes de terra illíus. ^ The Lord shall reign to eternity
column3: yea
column4: for ever and ever~; ye Gentiles shall perish from his land.

column1: 38 ^ Desidèrium páŭperum exaŭdívit Dòminus~; praĕparatiónem cordis eórum aŭdívit aŭris tua. ^ The Lord hath heard the desire of the poor~; thy ear hath heard the preparation of their heart.
39 ^ Judicáre pupìllo et húmili
column2: ut non appónat ultra magnificáre se hòmo super terram. ^ To judge for the fatherless and for the humble
column3: that man may no more presume to magnify himself upon earth.
